lines.text: [she pronounces it "Bouquet", and very, very shrilly]
The Bucket residence, the lady of the house speaking!
It's Bouquet! B-U-C-K-E-T!
[repeated line]
Sheridaaaaaaan!

[to Daisy]
What discourages me about looking for your father is we usually find him.

[repeated line about Hyacinth in a sad and depressed tone]
She'll sing at me, I know she will.
I've just been insulted on my own telephone!
I expect the opportunities are rare for being insulted on somebody else's.
This is not the Chinese restaurant. This is a residential number and you are speaking to the lady of the house on a white, slim line telephone with last number redial facility.
Today could be the day I'm mistaken for somebody important.
[repeated line]
It's my sister Violet! She's the one with the Mercedes, swimming pool, and room for a pony.

[on the phone]
No, I will not send over another portion of deep-fried squid. This is not the Chinese take-away. You are connected to a private residence on a white, slimlined telephone with last-number redial facility.
Oh, Richard. You know how much I love daddy. I would have him here if it wasn't for all the time he spends in the bathroom.
Listen, Daisy. Tell Onslow to put a shirt on while I'm on the telephone. I can always sense him there, expanding.
It's Bouquet!
Sit wherever you like, dear... *except* there! I always like to face the window.
I'm sorry Hyacinth, when I'm in this house I go to pieces.
Well some people just can't help being clumsy.
[repeated line]
Oh damn! It's the Bucket woman!
[repeated line]
Oh, nice!
Mind the pedestrian, Richard.
Minding the pedestrian...
Daisy, I am not just a play thing.

[in the car]
Mind the horse.
It's in the field.
Beautiful day Elizabeth!
Yes, isn't it?
Completely conducive to contemplating cozy charismatic country cottages!
Hyacinth, do you ever wonder why Sheridan shows very little interest in girls?
[repeated line]
It's my sister Daisy. She's not the one with the Mercedes, sauna and room for a pony.
Take your shoes off before you enter the house, dear.
[repeated line]
Coffee in ten minutes, Elizabeth! Bring Emmet!
I would be very pleased if you would accept my invitation to one my candlelight suppers.
Rose, that skirt's too short!
If my Sheridan were here he'd be appalled!
Richard a little decorum please, that is not the sort of behaviour one would expect from a person with a reservation for a quailty cruise
I want you to instruct your superiors that this is a first class stamp residence.
All the men like Rose, that's her problem.
What a wonderful sense of duty Daddy has.
Onslow, father's on the roof again!
Ask him if he's got my bottle opener!
Ooooh! It's the Chairlady of the Women's Luncheon Club.
Ewww...

[to Richard, after she picks up the phone]
It's Sheridan!
How much does he want?
Oh, stop it, Richard! I'm sure he's just calling to say hello to his mommy.
[on the phone, to Sheridan]
Now, what is it dear?
[stops and blinks]
You want 90?
[repeated line]
Now don't be silly, Richard!
And you are?... Regional Postal Manager. I guess you will do, though I would have preferred to speak to someone on a national scale.
Oh, don't make difficulties, Richard!
Your suggestion is noted. However, I see little practical merit in having the telephone up my jumper!

[Repeated line]
Is there any more beer?
